citation.article-title: Taxonomic studies on some human cutaneous coryneform bacteria: description of Dermabacter hominis gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Dermabacter hominis sp. nov.
Dermabacter hominis (ho'mi.nis. L.n. homo man; L.gen.n. hominis of man; named for the host on whose skin the species was isolated)
Surface colonies are small, cream, white, low convex.
Cells are Gram-positive, non-acid fast, non-motile, short rods.
Grows at 37 °C but not at 10°C; some strains grow at 45°C.
Grows in 5% NaCl.
Facultatively anaerobic.
Catalase positive and oxidase negative.

Acid is produced from Nacetylglucosamine, amygdalin, cellobiose, fructose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, D-glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannose, melezitose, metibiose, D-raffinose, ribose, sucrose, trehalose and D-turanose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, glycerol, glycogen, 2-ceto-gluconate, 5-ceto-gluconate, gluconate, inositol, inulin, mannitol, α-methyl-D-mannoside, β-methyl-D-xyloside, rhanmose, sorbitol, D-tagatose, L-xylose and xylitol.
Some strains produce acid from arbutin, D-lyxose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, saticin, and o-xylose.
Aesculin, casein and starch are hydrolysed.
Gelatin is liquefied.
Some strains hydrolyse Tween 80 weakly (4-7 days).
Arginine, cellulose, hippurate, tyrosine and xanthine are not hydrolysed.

Leucine arylamidase, lecithinase, α-glucosidase and α-mannosidase positive, α- Galactosidase, B-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, ornithine decarboxylase, sulphatase, urease and valine arylamidase negative.
Nitrate is not reduced.
H2S is produced by some strains.
Voges-Proskauer negative.
Cell wall peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid, alanine and glutamic acid.
Mycotic acids are not present.
The principal menaquinone is MK-9 with MK-8 and MK-7 also present in substantial amounts.
The long-chain fatty acids are predominantly of the iso- and anteiso-methyl branched types.
The major polar lipids consist of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, some phospholipids and a diglycosyldiacylglycerol.
The mol% G + C content of DNA is 62 (Tm).
The type strain is NCFB 2769 (=S69).
Description of the type strain In most respects the description of the type strain resembles the description of the species.
The type strain produces acid from arbutin but not from α-methyl-D-glucoside, D-lyxose, salicin and D-xylose.
Tween 80 is hydrolysed after 4-7 days.
